newsitem.title: FRANCE: Suspected separatists blast Corsican town hall.
newsitem.headline: Suspected separatists blast Corsican town hall.

text.p: A bomb planted by suspected Corsican separatists damaged a town hall in the east of the Mediterranean island on Sunday, police said.
The blast, the 13th since violence flared up 10 days ago, damaged offices in the Prunelli di Fiumorbu town hall shortly after midnight. No one was hurt.
The bomb damaged the entrance hall, a telephone switchboard and another office.
No one claimed responsibility for the attack, which bore the hallmarks of Corsican separatists battling for greater autonomy from Paris.
